page.title: 07Lyford Village
page.content: The small village of Lyford lies in an area of arable flatland, and is served by only 2 minor roads. Approx. 50-60 people live in and around Lyford, and there are about 20 dwellings of quite differing sizes. There are some Almshouses which were endowed by Oliver Ashcombe (one-time owner of considerable estates) who died in 1611. These homes, of which there were originally ten form a picturesque quadrangle. The living accommodation was recently brought up-to-date, and now, as Alms Court, there are 5 cottages administered by a Trust and let at nominal rents to elderly persons. There are 2 manor houses: Manor Farm which is adjacent to the church, and Lyford Grange. There is also the small chapel of St. Mary the Virgin.
